title: Strengthening Service Quality Practical Competencies: Utilizing Sampling Techniques for Predicting No-Shows in Medical Appointments

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners can explain the characteristics of imbalanced datasets and apply them to medical appointment no-show prediction problems.
Learners can compare the principles and application methods of major sampling techniques, including ROS, RUS, SMOTE, ADASYN, ENN, and CNN.
Learners can apply sampling techniques to decision tree classification models to improve the accuracy of medical appointment no-show predictions.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
